personal_info.current_title: Executive Leader in Infrastructure Delivery & Commercial Strategy
personal_info.summary: I lead multibillion-dollar infrastructure megaprojects across North America and Europe, specializing in complex alternative delivery models. With a unique blend of commercial acumen, technical rigor, and legal insight, I consistently optimize project outcomes, cultivate stakeholder trust, and expand market share for leading construction enterprises
personal_info.about_description:
I am a seasoned executive with over two decades of global leadership, spearheading multibillion-dollar infrastructure megaprojects across North America and Europe. My expertise lies in orchestrating complex alternative delivery models—including DB, P3, CMAR, and PDB—to drive unparalleled project outcomes, optimize commercial strategy, and cultivate enduring stakeholder trust.

My track record isn't just about delivery; it's about transforming project performance. I consistently reduce costs, enhance operational excellence, and build high-performing, resilient teams that thrive under pressure. With a multidisciplinary background in civil engineering, business, and law, I possess a unique ability to translate intricate technical and legal complexities into clear strategic pathways, empowering bold team leadership and deep client confidence.

I am singularly focused on expanding market share and delivering sustainable growth for forward-thinking construction enterprises, turning complex infrastructure challenges into strategic opportunities. If you're exploring ways to strengthen delivery performance or structure high-value infrastructure deals, let's connect.

core_competencies: P3, DB, CMAR, PDB and Alliance delivery models

responsibilities: Leading multidisciplinary project delivery efforts for nationally significant rail infrastructure programs under progressive delivery models.
Responsible for aligning construction execution with design coordination, commercial strategy, and stakeholder interface across joint venture and owner organizations.
Supporting delivery of the $1B+ Long Bridge North PDB Project and $2.7B Susquehanna River Rail Bridge CMAR Project, two critical Northeast Corridor infrastructure investments.
Serving as a key interface with Amtrak, VPRA, VRE, FRA, and CSX, bridging technical, commercial, and stakeholder considerations.
Collaborating across internal disciplines (design, procurement, controls, field) to support efficient and compliant execution.
Supported strategic capture and preconstruction efforts for large-scale transportation infrastructure pursuits, with a focus on public-private partnerships (P3s) and progressive delivery models.
Contributed to winning and advancing major proposals, including the $2.3B LADOTD I-10 Calcasieu River Bridge P3 and the $4.6B GDOT SR-400 Express Lanes P3.
Strengthened proposal quality through technical input, commercial review, and stakeholder alignment strategies.
Facilitated agency and stakeholder meetings to ensure transparency, responsiveness, and client trust.
Collaborated across engineering, legal, and commercial teams to build compelling value propositions for owners.
Led multidisciplinary teams across complex infrastructure pursuits, contributing to the successful capture and setup of major transportation programs in Canada.
Played a key role in bids for projects including EHTH Alliance, Scarborough SE PDB, and led RFQ strategy for the Ontario Line – EGS PDB.
Drove project success through effective team coordination, early works planning, and strategic partnerships.
Implemented project management best practices to improve efficiency, scope alignment, and team performance.
Built and maintained strong relationships with public owners, consultants, and community stakeholders, ensuring alignment across delivery partners.

Provided technical leadership and design integration support on one of Texas’s largest DB infrastructure projects, ensuring alignment between construction execution, design deliverables, and contractual compliance.
Delivered RFC design packages for the $950M TxDOT Grand Parkway Segments H, I-1, and I-2 DB Project.
Oversaw/designed and processed over 300 design change modifications, improving constructability, safety, and cost-effectiveness.
Led the project Construction Technical Office, supporting the U.S. management team with design coordination and field implementation strategy.
Acted as a key liaison with JV partners to ensure contract compliance and effective execution under the DB model.
Led integrated technical and commercial functions on a major P3 highway project in Indiana, contributing to the successful delivery of a critical corridor expansion for INDOT.
Managed technical oversight and commercial strategy for the $400M I-69 Section 5 P3 Project, covering a 21-mile interstate segment.
Coordinated design-build execution, project controls, and procurement to ensure alignment with contractual obligations and performance goals.
Supported owner engagement and risk management processes across project phases.
Managed and led design and supervision teams for construction, tunneling, geotechnical, and structural engineering projects with a portfolio of €1B
Oversaw the design of large-scale infrastructure projects featuring over 14 km of tunnels and 5 km of bridges on high-speed rail and highways
Expanded the company's scope to include bridge projects, improving design rates by 20%
Mentored, coached, and trained over 20 new engineers
Directed construction projects including design improvement, budgeting, planning, subcontracting, procurement, quality control, safety compliance, and environmental management
Managed the construction of the High-Speed Rail from Legutiano to Escoriatza project, a joint venture with a budget of €60M
Oversaw the Gernika Sewer improvements project with a budget of €11M
Managed the construction of the High-Speed Rail Cornellà del Terri to Vilademuls project, with an €80M budget, involving tunnels and pre-stressed concrete bridges
Oversaw design improvement, budgeting, planning, subcontracting, procurement, quality control, safety compliance, and environmental management
Supervised the construction of the Urumea highway from Martutene to Astigarraga project, a 6 km highway project with a budget of €67M
Managed supervision for the 8 km Toll Road AP1 from Eibar to Bergara with a budget of €79M
